content.description: Start on left sloping hand and right hand on a decent crimp. Match on a weirdly textured sloper at about face level, and set up for a big move up left to an edge. Work your way up the rest of the route on crimps and big edges to a mildly sketchy top, making sure to utilize a fantastically sculpted square crimp along the way.
content.location: Start in the moss streak to the right of the bald face moving up and slightly right.

content.description: Start on the obvious triangle undercling in the clean section in the center of the wall. Go up and right to a small crimp before gaining a good edge under a crack. Use the small crack to pull yourself up to the final holds, and get over. Be careful when topping out, the top holds aren’t great.
content.location: Start on the obvious triangular undercling.

content.description: This is a fun route, but it is kind of mossy.
content.location: Start on jugs on the right side of the rock, then go up using crimps and edges to top out.

content.description: Start on decent edges under the rock shelves on the left side of the cliff. The start is the hardest part. The rest is a jug haul to the top of the wall. This has easy, sustained climbing throughout the route.
content.protection: A decent amount of pads and a spotter.
content.location: On the left side of the cliff, right before the cliff becomes small, stand start on the crimps, and go up.

content.description: Flex Cliff is the highest bouldering area in the reservation reaching heights of about 19 feet. As of now, the rock is very dirty and needs some serious cleaning. Though the rock is also very big, so the potential for routes is very high. This is probably the best area at Wilson Reservation, and it shows the most potential.  There are 3 bolts on top of the cliff which are kind of sketchy. We assume they were for sometype of topropes but wouldn’t recommend using them for that. If you do use them use them at your own discretion. Note: please make the names of the routes reflect the commercial of "Flex Tape" or "Flex Seal".
